Key Match Events: Elly De La Cruz connected on a slider for his 25th homer to right field for a 6-0 lead.
De La Cruz knocked a two-out single to drive in Noelvi Marte for a 4-0 lead.
Cook hit a leadoff home run for the Pirates to left-center field against reliever Alan Busenitz.
Post-Match Reflections: The Reds (76-80), who won the opener of the three-game set on Friday, have won five of their past eight games.
Cincinnati starting pitcher Rhett Lowder (2-2) held Pittsburgh scoreless on five hits through five innings.
Billy Cook had a home run among his two hits for the Pirates (72-83), who have lost seven of nine.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pittsburgh Pirates had just five baserunners through the first four innings before threatening in the fifth.
Isiah Kiner-Falefa singled with one out and Oneil Cruz drew a two-out walk, prompting a visit from pitching coach Derek Johnson.
Nick Gonzales followed with a single to load the bases, but Lowder got Bryan De La Cruz to fly out.
